#Text=Wikinews interviews Diego Grez , Chilean earthquake survivor
#Text=Thursday , March 4 , 2010
#Text=File : Diego Grez - 2 . jpg
#Text=Diego Grez .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=An 8.8 magnitude earthquake hit Chile on Saturday , causing significant damage throughout parts of the country .
#Text=Diego Grez ( a Wikinews correspondent by the pen name MisterWiki ) was in Pichilemu at the time of the quake .
#Text=Four days after the quake , Peter Coti , also a Wikinews contributor , was able to chat with Mr. Grez about what happened Saturday morning .
#Text=Interview
#Text=What is the status of power , gas and water ?
#Text=The electricity was restored last night , after more than 3 days without radio , cellphone or TV , in a few words , without communication .
#Text=There was never any problem with the gas or water here in Pichilemu , but there are a near town called Bucalemu that has been 4 days without any of those .
#Text=How is the government responding in your area ?
#Text=It has been slow .
#Text=Mainly , I was surprised because the mayor of the city was not here during the quake .
#Text=He was far away and he have got here in Sunday .
#Text=We did n't receive food until yesterday .
#Text=The people was very scared and the government has n't been seen after the quake .
#Text=I went quickly to the nearest hill , to be safe of a possible tsunami without help of anyone .
#Text=What is going on right now ?
#Text=We are on the hill right now , far away from my house .
#Text=I 'm very worried about my house .
#Text=Is the infrastructure stable ?
#Text=Yes .
#Text=Fortunately , the most of the Pichilemu houses are secure including mine .
#Text=Are there a lot of people on the hill with you ?
#Text=Yes .
#Text=But every day that passes there are less .
#Text=Can you summarize what happened to you during the quake ?
#Text=I was sleeping .
#Text=My Dad came down from the second floor and said to my Mom that it was a shake .
#Text=I have to say that my Dad was very scared .
#Text=My mom went out with my dad .
#Text=The shake did n't stopped and then they called me and my sister .
#Text=The house moved from side to side .
#Text=I really thought it was going to fall .
#Text=It was 3 or 4 minutes long .
#Text=After it , when we wanted to go back for cellphone , a radio and clothes ( we all were in pajamas ) , then some aftershocks took place .
#Text=We then ran the car and changed .
#Text=Outside there were many other people running to the nearest hill , called Cerro ( Hill ) La Cruz .
#Text=The La Cruz Hill was flooded with cars and people crying .
#Text=It was really a sad situation .
#Text=In addition of that , people was looting cars .
#Text=And the people was urinating and excreting anywhere .
#Text=The hill became very dirty .
#Text=We stayed on the hill until the day before yesterday .
#Text=We went to our house .
#Text=And there did n't happened anything .
#Text=Just a glass was broken .
#Text=A strong aftershock happened and we ran away again .
#Text=Now there 's no problem to be there .
#Text=I can happily say that we had no further problems .
#Text=Is the local hospital operational ?
#Text=The ill people were taken to a high school , because of the risk of a new tsunami , but they were taken back soon .
#Text=Thank you for your time and I wish you and your country good luck in the recovery process .
#Text=Thank you .
